author: D Madhavan
text:
It was not just the jallikattu enthusiasts who were rejoicing after the government order restored the sport on Friday. Among those who were celebrating were rekla racers.

A rekla race involves getting race bulls lugging makeshift carts to run a certain distance, the winners are given prizes, and just like jallikattu , this sport used to be popular during the three-day Pongal festival.

Popular sport

It was popular in some parts of Tamil Nadu before the ban came up, including in Chennai and the Coimbatore region.

“In his memoir, Na Chinnanati Muchchatlu (Memories of my Childhood), Dr. K.N. Kesari, well-known 19th century ayurvedic physician, mentioned about his frequent visits to the Fair especially Rekla race at the Moore Market complex [in Chennai] ,” says historian V. Sriram.

title: Rekla race: a century-old sport in Tamil Nadu
